column4: hello, i have a problem with my wireless connection in thinkpad T420
i just installed ubuntu and could not use see any wireless card/interface
what's wrong with it, mine worked out of the box on my T420
i was using windows, and just installed ubuntu today
what wifi card do you have? make sure to have the hardware killswitch enabled (right side, just behind the optical drive). you may also try pressing Fn+F5 until the wifi led turns on
and I've heard that if you disabled the wifi card in windows it may for some laptops not be visible from Linux after a reboot
well, does lspci say something about a "Intel Corporation Centrino Ultimate-N 6300" controller or something?
i have enabled in windows. i was using it. everything is on.
network controller: intel corporation 6000 series gen2 and "communication controller: intel corporation cougar point heci controller #1"
actually, only the first one ;-)
well, I have the 6300 and it worked right out of the box with the iwlwifi kernel driver
you can try to load that manually (sudo modprobe iwlwifi) and see if there are any errors in dmesg output
alright, will try now
module iwlwifi not found
err, sorry, it's called iwlagn
same, not found "iwlagn"
that's strange, according to dpkg, my module is from linux-image-3.0.0-8-generic (I use the kernel from oneiric because of UEFI), so it should come with linux-image-generic
is there any way to find the module and install/
http://packages.ubuntu.com/search?searchon=contents&keywords=iwlagn.ko&mode=exactfilename&suite=natty&arch=any

um, if you have a linux kernel (and you should have one when you can boot the system ;-)), you should also have this module. Unless something went terribly wrong... you could try "sudo apt-get install --reinstall linux-image-2.6.38-8-generic"
it is actually backbuntu
um, which means?
it is not the full ubuntu, it is a "relative" of ubuntu
